title: 111_s3905
content: Enhancement of Transition Assistance Program. The Secretary of Defense will ensure that all discharged members of the Armed Forces participate in the Transition Assistance Program. The program will also be accessible to National Guard and Reserves members. Additionally, services provided will include employment and training information tailored to different military grades. The Transition Assistance Program for discharged members of the Armed Forces includes expanded education benefits, information on other VA benefits, enhanced financial management training, and dedicated computer training on employment-related websites. The curr_chunk discusses the requirement for the Secretary to submit reports on the implementation of training for National Guard and Reserves members under the Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act. The reports are to be submitted every six months to the appropriate committees of Congress. The Secretary must submit reports on training for National Guard and Reserves members under the Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act every six months to specific committees of Congress. SEC. 2. REPORT ON TRANSITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM. The Secretary of Defense, in consultation with the Secretary of Labor, must submit a report to Congress within 270 days of the enactment of this Act on the Transition Assistance Program of the Department of Defense. The report should include an analysis of post-separation employment rates compared to the general population since September 11, 2001, a summary of the program's evolution since that date, and efforts to transition it to a life-cycle model. The report to Congress on the Transition Assistance Program of the Department of Defense includes an analysis of challenges faced by former Armed Forces members in the civilian workforce and an assessment of the program's effectiveness. The report to Congress on the Transition Assistance Program of the Department of Defense includes recommendations for improving the program, such as providing it to members earlier before separation, assessing the quality of trainers, evaluating the success of marketing efforts, and making appropriate recommendations for legislative action. The Transition Assistance Program report includes recommendations for improvement, focusing on quality and efficacy. The term "appropriate committees of Congress" is defined in the section.
